summary: A malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor (MPNST) is a rare form of cancer of the connective tissue surrounding peripheral nerves, classified as a sarcoma. It is one of the most common non-rhabdomyosarcoma soft tissue sarcomas in the pediatric population.
causes: Loss of heterozygosity on the 17p chromosome
Mutation in the p53 tumor suppressor gene
symptoms: Difficulty in moving the extremity with the tumor
Soreness localized to the tumor area or extremity
Pain or discomfort (numbness, burning, pins and needles)
